definitions.definition: A visible, narrow, and intense (relative to ambient light) ray of sunlight.
An item of cutlery or crockery laid out on a table, but not used, and which can be returned to the drawer without being washed.
Any of various lycaenid butterflies of the genus Curetis.
Any hummingbird of the genus Aglaeactis.
The direct rays, light or warmth of the sun.
definitions.example: We were warmed by the bright sunshine.

definitions.definition: A location on which the sun's rays fall.
definitions.example: We moved out of the shade and into the sunshine.

definitions.definition: Geniality or cheerfulness.
definitions.example: I enjoyed the sunshine of her smile.

definitions.definition: A source of cheerfulness or joy.
The effect which the sun has when it lights and warms some place.
Friendly form of address often reserved for juniors.
definitions.example: Alright sunshine, safe to cross now.

definitions.definition: Ironic form of address used to an inferior or troublemaker.
definitions.example: OK, sunshine, listen up and listen good. There's five vandalised telephone boxes out there and I know you're responsible.

definitions.definition: Used to address someone who has just woken up and/or is very sleepy.
definitions.example: Good morning, sunshine!

definitions.definition: A person with pronounced muscular development and low body fat.
: Theoretical body type in which a person naturally has lower body fat and greater ability to achieve muscular development than average.

Any substance or drug that reduces pain, induces sleep and may alter mood or behaviour; in some contexts, especially in reference to the opiates-and-opioids class, especially in reference to illegal drugs, and often both.
Any type of numbing drug.
Of, or relating to narcotics.
(pharmaceutical effect) Inducing sleep; causing narcosis.
The chemical element with atomic number 78 and symbol Pt; a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, silverish-white transition metal of great value.
A whitish grey colour, like that of the metal.
A single or album that has achieved platinum sales, i.e. over 1 million or 2 million.
To reach platinum level in a game
definitions.example: I platinumed in Clash of Clans yesterday.

definitions.definition: Of a whitish grey colour, like that of the metal.
Of a musical recording that has sold over one million copies (for singles), or two million (for albums).
A person who wrestles.
The sum of the distance of all the lengths of the sides of an object.
The length of such a boundary.
The outer limits of an area.
A fortified strip or boundary usually protecting a military position.
An instrument for determining the extent and shape of the field of vision.
In a smooth manner
Yielding to the touch, and easily moved or shaken; hanging loose by its own weight; lacking firmness; flaccid.
(of wine) Having a slight lack of acidity; having mild sweetness.
(of writing, etc.) overwrought.
Which forms a surjection from the domain to every open subset of the codomain.
definitions.example: a flabby sheaf on a paracompact space

definitions.definition: A line that is a base for measurement or for construction.
definitions.example: A laser level generates a convenient baseline for interior work.

definitions.definition: A datum used as the basis for calculation or for comparison.
definitions.example: We used the last doctor visit to provide baselines for vital statistics.

definitions.definition: A line used as the basis for the alignment of glyphs.
definitions.example: Several characters typically have descenders below the lower baseline.

definitions.definition: The line at the farthest ends of the court indicating the boundary of the area of play.
definitions.example: The umpire missed the call. The ball hit the baseline.

definitions.definition: A configuration of software, hardware, or a process that is established and documented as a point of reference.
definitions.example: The baseline configuration includes unsupported components.

definitions.definition: To provide a baseline for measurement.
To play from the baseline.
An advocate of globalism.
definitions.example: You are either a globalist or a nationalist; one cannot be both.

definitions.definition: One who believes that Adolf Hitler intended to extend the Third Reich beyond the continent of Europe.
Of or pertaining to globalism.
Suspecting rivalry in love; troubled by worries that one might have been replaced in someone's affections; suspicious of a lover's or spouse's fidelity.
Protective, zealously guarding, careful in the protection of something one has or appreciates.
definitions.example: For you must not worship any other god, for the Lord, whose name is Jehovah, is a jealous God. —Exodus 34:14 (NET)

definitions.definition: Envious; feeling resentful or angered toward someone for a perceived advantage or success, material or otherwise.
Suspecting, suspicious.
A type of business that is obsolescent.
A savory Valencian dish made of rice, cooked on a frying pan with vegetables and meat or shellfish.
A plant (Ocimum basilicum).
The leaves of this plant used as a herb.
Any other species in the genus Ocimum.
The angle to which a joiner's tool is ground away.
To grind the edge of a tool to an acute angle.
The skin of a sheep tanned with bark.
Of opinions, propositions or questions, subject to dispute; not settled.
Canis lupus dingo, a wild dog native to Australia.
A dish of meat and beans in a tomato sauce flavoured with chili peppers.
To reduce in size or number.
definitions.example: Joe and Edna moved to a bungalow after deciding to downsize when the children had left home.

definitions.definition: To reduce the workforce of.
definitions.example: They downsized the division by offering attractive early-retirement packages and selling off an office building.

definitions.definition: To terminate the employment of.
definitions.example: Joe got downsized and became a plumber.

definitions.definition: A tree of the genus Fagus having a smooth, light grey trunk, oval, pointed leaves and many branches.
The wood of the beech tree.
A valley.
(usually seen in obituaries) Farewell.
definitions.example: Vale, Sarah Smith

definitions.definition: An angora cat.
A goat of a domesticated breed that produces mohair.

A rabbit belonging to the Angora rabbit breed, one of the oldest domestic breeds of rabbits in the world, raised chiefly in Europe for its silky and long hair (a subspecies of the European rabbit, Oryctolagus cuniculus)
The hair of angora rabbits or angora goats, used to make textiles.
The fabric made from the hair of angora rabbits or angora goats.
A device attached to the gunwale of a rowboat to hold the oars in place while rowing.
Beetle measuring an average length of six millimeters (¼ inch), which feeds on cotton buds and flowers, native to Central America

A senior official in a college or university, who may be in charge of a division or faculty (for example, the dean of science) or have some other advisory or disciplinary function (for example, the dean of students).
A dignitary or presiding officer in certain church bodies, especially an ecclesiastical dignitary, subordinate to a bishop, in charge of a chapter of canons.
The senior member of some group of people.
To serve as a dean.
To send (a student) to see the dean of a university.
(chiefly in place names) A hill.
A bullet with a conical shape.
Of or relating to a cone or cones.
Shaped like a cone.
Describing a map projection in which meridians are mapped to equally spaced lines radiating out from the apex and parallels of latitude are mapped to circular arcs centred on the apex.
An open-topped box that can be slid in and out of the cabinet that contains it, used for storing clothing or other articles.
A side panel containing supplementary content.
Agent noun of draw; one who draws.
An artist who primarily makes drawings.
One who writes a bank draft, check/cheque, or promissory note.
A barman; a person who draws the beer from the taps.
Someone who taps palm sap for making toddy.
A wagoner or person who pushes underground tubs.

A kind of firearm formerly carried by the infantry of an army, originally fired by means of a match, or matchlock, for which several mechanical appliances (including the flintlock, and finally the percussion lock) were successively substituted; ultimately superseded by the rifle.
definitions.example: Sam, Sam, pick up thy musket.

definitions.definition: A male Eurasian sparrowhawk.
A tree, Adansonia digitata (and similar species), native to tropical Africa, having a broad swollen trunk and edible gourd-like hanging fruits.
A high-pitched, short and somewhat sharp sound.
definitions.example: My car used to make an odd ping, but after the last oil change it went away.

definitions.definition: (submarine navigation) A pulse of high-pitched or ultrasonic sound whose echoes provide information about nearby objects and vessels.
definitions.example: The submarine sent out a ping and got an echo from a battleship.

definitions.definition: A packet which a remote host is expected to echo, thus indicating its presence.
definitions.example: The network is overloaded from all the pings going out.

definitions.definition: An email or other message sent requesting acknowledgement.
definitions.example: I sent a ping to the insurance company to see if they received our claim.

definitions.definition: Latency.
A means of highlighting a feature on the game map so that allied players can see it.
(WMF jargon) A notification.
To make a high-pitched, short and somewhat sharp sound.
definitions.example: My car was pinging until my last oil change.

definitions.definition: (submarine navigation) To emit a signal and then listen for its echo in order to detect objects.
To send a packet in order to determine whether a host is present, particularly by use of the ping utility.
definitions.example: I'm pinging their server.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To send an email or other message to someone in hopes of eliciting a response.
definitions.example: I'll ping the insurance company again to see if they've received our claim.

definitions.definition: To flick.
definitions.example: I pinged the crumb off the table with my finger.

definitions.definition: To bounce.
definitions.example: The ball pinged off the wall and came hurtling back.

definitions.definition: To cause something to bounce.
To call out audibly.
To penalize.
definitions.example: Gary Ablett was pinged for holding the ball and gave away a free kick.

definitions.definition: Presenting more than one possible answer. A type of test question where the correct answer is selected from a group of proffered choices.
A man who labours for wages.
An artisan or craftsman.
A very slow tempo
A musical piece or movement in such a tempo
Strong and stately
A Middle Eastern salad or meze generally consisting of bulgur wheat, chopped tomatoes, parsley, olive oil and lemon juice.
Of the Western Christian church, as differentiated from e.g. the Orthodox church.
definitions.example: Christmas is celebrated at different dates in the Catholic and Orthodox calendars.

definitions.definition: Of the Roman Catholic church in particular.
definitions.example: Catholic churches are built differently than Protestant ones.

definitions.definition: Universal; all-encompassing.
Pertaining to all kinds of people and their range of tastes, proclivities etc.; liberal.
A brightly colored cotton fabric with a checked or striped pattern.
A large handkerchief of this fabric, worn on the head in the West Indies.
To take a long position in.
To await, aspire, desire greatly (something to occur or to be true)
definitions.example: She longed for him to come back.

definitions.definition: To be appropriate to, to pertain or belong to.
To belong.
An earnest and deep, not greatly passionate, but rather melancholic desire.
The buying of a financial instrument with the expectation that its value will rise
The area on either side of a road.
definitions.example: I pulled over to the roadside to check the map.

definitions.definition: Located beside a road.
definitions.example: The roadside stand did a good business just selling products to people who merely wanted directions.

definitions.definition: Characterized by speculation; based on guessing, unfounded opinions, or extrapolation.
Pursued as a gamble, with possible large profits or losses; risky.
Pertaining to financial speculation; Involving or resulting from high-risk investments or trade.
Used to express assent, especially to a male superior.
Used to express emphatic affirmation.
A large Australasian bat, of the genera Pteropus or Acerodon in the family Pteropodidae, having a fox-like face.
Any bat of the family Pteropodidae (see Usage notes).
The cyprinid fish Epalzeorhynchos kalopterus.
A device consisting of a chair suspended on a pulley, and running along a length of cable, used for transporting across ravines etc.
A vibrant light purple, purplish-red, reddish-purple, or pinkish purple colour obtained by mixing red and blue light (thus a secondary colour), but primary in the CMYK colour system used in printing.
Having the colour of fuchsia, fuchsine, light purple.
The speed of an aircraft relative to the air through which it is flying.
An awkward, ungainly person.
Awkward, ungainly; lacking grace or dexterity in movement
A person, usually male, responsible for retrieving balls from the area of play, and returning them to the players.
To install signposts on.
definitions.example: The route wasn't signposted, and we got lost on the way.

definitions.definition: To direct (somebody) to services, resources, etc.
To indicate logical progress of a discourse using words or phrases such as now, right, to recap, to sum up, as I was saying, etc.
To signal, as if with a signpost
An adjustable dam placed across a river to regulate the flow of water downstream.
A fence placed across a river to catch fish.
Some text or a graphic in an electronic document that can be activated to display another document or trigger an action.
definitions.example: Click the hyperlink to go to the next page.

definitions.definition: (by extension) An address, URL, or program that defines a hyperlink's function.
definitions.example: Copy the hyperlink and paste it into an email.

definitions.definition: (of a hypertext document) To point to another document by a hyperlink.
To add a hyperlink to a document.
To use a hyperlink to jump to a document.
The branch of medicine concerned with the study of the nature of disease and its causes, processes, development, and consequences.
The medical specialty that provides microscopy and other laboratory services (e.g., cytology, histology) to clinicians.
definitions.example: The surgeon sent a specimen of the cyst to the pathology department for staining and analysis to determine its histologic subtype.

definitions.definition: Pathosis: any deviation from a healthy or normal structure or function; abnormality; illness or malformation.
Any organic compound containing both an amino and a carboxylic acid functional group.

Any of the twenty naturally occurring α-amino acids (having the amino, and carboxylic acid groups on the same carbon atom), and a variety of side chains, that combine, via peptide bonds, to form proteins.
A plucked stringed instrument with five or seven steel strings stretched on a long fretted finger-board over two gourds, used mostly in Carnatic Indian classical music.

A symbol or numerical sign placed on a stave to indicate the meter; in the case of a numerical time signature, the numerator is the number of beats per bar, the denominator represents the value of each beat
A typically soft seat placed in a recess, for a window, in a wall, and filling the recess.
A seat beside a window in public transport, as in a bus, train or passenger aircraft.
An expression of disbelief.
definitions.example: Come off it, mate! You can't be serious.

definitions.definition: Faulty functioning
Failure to function
To function improperly
definitions.example: She told him the machine was poorly built, but they both knew that she was the one who had malfunctioned.

definitions.definition: To fail to function
A course over which any type of races are run.
A characteristic circular erosion pattern in deposition processes.
A large, oriental, round-bottomed cooking pan.
To prepare oriental cuisine using a wok.
Of or relating to a person's life or an account of a person's life, as told by the subject.
Any of many marine invertebrates, of the phylum Brachiopoda, that have bivalve dorsal and ventral shells with two tentacle-bearing arms that capture food
Electrophorus electricus, a species of fish resembling an eel (though not related) that is capable of generating powerful electric shocks.
A plumber's snake powered by electricity.
(grammar) A clause that can stand alone syntactically as a complete sentence and contains at least a subject and a verb.
A short narrative illustrating a lesson (usually religious/moral) by comparison or analogy.
definitions.example: Catholic sermons normally draw on at least one Biblical lecture, often parables.

definitions.definition: To represent by parable.
That can easily be prepared or procured; obtainable.
A musician who plays a bass instrument, especially the bass guitar.
The female gamete in animals; the egg cell.
A band of fabric encircling the waist, especially a part of a pair of pants or a skirt.
A large kerchief, usually colourful and used either as headgear or as a handkerchief, neckerchief, bikini, or sweatband.

A style of calico printing, in which white or bright spots are produced upon cloth previously dyed a uniform red or dark colour, by discharging portions of the color by chemical means, while the rest of the cloth is under pressure.
A storm consisting of thunder and lightning produced by a cumulonimbus, usually accompanied with heavy rain, wind, and sometimes hail; and in rarer cases sleet, freezing rain, or snow.
To lock away; to imprison, especially for breaking the law.
To confine; to shut up or enclose; to hem in.
Victory gained through combat; the subjugation of an enemy.
(by extenstion) An act or instance of overcoming an obstacle.
That which is conquered; possession gained by force, physical or moral.
(feudal law) The acquiring of property by other means than by inheritance; acquisition.
A person whose romantic affections one has gained, or with whom one has had sex.
A competitive mode found in first-person shooter games in which competing teams (usually two) attempt to take over predetermined spawn points labeled by flags.
To conquer.

To compete with an established competitor by placing advertisements for one's own products adjacent to editorial content relating to the competitor or by using terms and keywords for one's own products that are currently associated with the competitor.
Any system by which time is divided into days, weeks, months, and years.
definitions.example: The three principal calendars are the Gregorian, Jewish, and Islamic calendars.

definitions.definition: A means to determine the date consisting of a document containing dates and other temporal information.
definitions.example: Write his birthday on the calendar hanging on the wall.

definitions.definition: A list of planned events.
definitions.example: The club has a busy calendar this year.

definitions.definition: An orderly list or enumeration of persons, things, or events; a schedule.
definitions.example: a calendar of bills presented in a legislative assemblly;  a calendar of causes arranged for trial in court

definitions.definition: An appointment book (US), appointment diary (UK)
To set a date for a proceeding in court, usually done by a judge at a calendar call.
definitions.example: The judge agreed to calendar a hearing for pretrial motions for the week of May 15, but did not agree to calendar the trial itself on a specific date.

definitions.definition: To enter or write in a calendar; to register.

A percussion instrument (idiophone) of Spanish origin, consisting of a pair of concave shells joined on one edge by a string, held in the hand and used to produce clicking sounds; any hand-held percussion idiophone that can be played with the fingers, such as bones or spoons.
An angle formed between one side of a polygon and an extension of an adjacent side.
A kind of sponge cake soaked in rum-flavoured syrup.
(esp. among people of East European ancestry) A grandmother.
An old woman, especially a traditional old woman from an eastern European culture.
(esp. among people of Indian ancestry) A father.
(Hinduism, Islam, Sikhism) A holy man, a spiritual leader.
A baby, child.
In baby talk, often used for a variety of words beginning with b, such as bottle or blanket.
An auto-immune disease characterised by sensitivity of the lining of the small intestine to gluten, causing a failure to digest food properly.
A person who is skilled in, professes or practices dermatology.
To injure the brain of, usually temporarily, by violent impact.
definitions.example: The blow will concuss him.

definitions.definition: To force to do something, or give up something, by intimidation; to coerce.
Knocked out, temporarily confused or unconscious due to a blow to the head
